alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 10:01PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Crittenden, DeSoto, northeastern Tunica, north central Tate and southern Shelby Counties through 1030 PM CST... At 1000 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hernando, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, West Memphis, Horn Lake, Hernando, Marion, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Walls, Lake Cormorant, Southwest Memphis, Eudora, Lewisburg, Whitehaven, Midtown Memphis, Lynchburg, Southeast Memphis and Downtown Memphis. This includes Interstate 40 near mile marker 1, and between mile markers 11 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
